fields.label: Type
fields.description: Optional media to display above the question.

semantics.label: Task description
semantics.description: Describe how the user should solve the task.
semantics.placeholder: Click on all the verbs in the text that follows.

semantics.label: Distractor delimiter character (optional)
semantics.description: Select the character to be used for delimiting distractors (wrong words/groups of words).

important.description:
• Tutorial and Examples: Papi Jo's Drupal test site
  • Correct words/groups of words are marked with asterisks (*) before and after the word/group.
  • Asterisks can be added within marked words by adding another asterisk, e.g. "6 = *2**3*" => "2*3".
  • Words can be divided into syllables by using the normal hyphen character (-).
  • Put any word/group of words between square brackets to make them [non-selectable].
  • The 'Mark selectable words' option is especially useful if your Textfield contains *groups of words*. Remember to add distractors to the text by adding your selected distractor delimiter (above), e.g. with underscores e.g. _this is a distractor_ or _distractor_. If this option is selected it's not necessary to use []. All the words which are un-marked are also non-selectable.
  • For phonetic transcription, please use the British English system, with forward slashes as in the example below.

fields.label: Define custom feedback for any score range
fields.description: Click the "Add range" button to add as many ranges as you need. Example: 0-20% Bad score, 21-91% Average Score, 91-100% Great Score! You can use these variables in your feedback text: @total, @correct, @wrong and @missed. Example: You have correctly selected @correct words, incorrectly selected @wrong ones and missed @missed ones. When the student checks their answers, these variable names will be replaced with their current values.

semantics.label: Score too low to display Solution
semantics.description: @minscore and @maxscore are placeholders that will be replaced by their respective values when this message is displayed to the student.
semantics.default: The solution won't be available until your score is at least @minscore/@maxscore.

semantics.label: Behavioural settings.
semantics.description: These options will let you control how the task behaves.

fields.label: Minimum score percentage
fields.description: Minimum score percentage to obtain before Solutions can be displayed. Enter 0(%) OR leave empty for no minimum limit.

fields.label: Mark selectable words?
fields.description: Check this box if you want selectable words or groups of words to be displayed inside borders.

fields.label: Display mode for ticks and score points
fields.description: Select the display mode to be used to mark each word when the student checks their answers. If your text contains parts of words it's preferrable to use the 3rd mode (ticks or crosses above the words).

options.label: Display scorepoints and ticks or crosses
Display ticks or crosses above the words

fields.label: Enable the 'Spot The Mistakes' mode
fields.description: This mode swaps your correct <-> incorrect answers. The student will have to click on the mistakes/wrong answers. The correctly spotted wrong answers will be marked as correct (and give the point).

fields.label: Hide mistakes at the end
fields.description: If you check this option, the correctly spotted wrong answers will disappear from the text when the activity is finished (i.e. when the maximum score has been reached).

fields.label: Keep correct answers
fields.description: Check this option if you want to keep the correct answers displayed after pressing 'Retry'. Not available in the Spot The Mistakes mode as it would give away the solutions.

fields.label: Remove hyphens
fields.description: Select this option if you do not want the 'parts of words' separator (hyphen) to be displayed.

semantics.label: Correct answer text
semantics.description: Text used to indicate that an answer is correct

semantics.label: Incorrect answer text
semantics.description: Text used to indicate that an answer is incorrect

semantics.label: Missed answer text
semantics.description: Text used to indicate that an answer is missing

semantics.label: Spotted mistake text
semantics.description: Text used to indicate that a mistake has been correctly spotted

semantics.label: Incorrectly marked mistake text
semantics.description: Text used to indicate that a word has been incorrectly marked as a mistake

semantics.label: Description for Display Solution
semantics.default: Task is updated to contain the solution.
semantics.description: This text tells the user that the tasks has been updated with the solution.

semantics.label: Textual representation of the score bar for those using a readspeaker
Label for the full readable text for assistive technologies
Label for the text where words can be marked for assistive technologies
semantics.default: Full text where words can be marked

semantics.label: Solution mode header for assistive technologies
Checking mode header for assistive technologies
Assistive technology description for "Check" button
semantics.default: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.

semantics.label: Assistive technology description for "Show Solution" button
semantics.default: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.

semantics.label: Assistive technology description for "Retry" button
semantics.default: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
